title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Commerce extension before 0.9.9 for TYPO3 allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2009-4963
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20091124075813/http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-sa-2009-011
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200228211059/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/36133
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rmc9-5546-5rrf
items.title: [commerceteam/commerce] Commerce extension for TYPO3 vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the back end in Joomla! 1.5 through 1.5.17 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unknown vectors related to "various administrator screens," possibly the search parameter in administrator/index.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1649
  • http://developer.joomla.org/security/news/314-20100501-core-xss-vulnerabilities-in-back-end.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+JoomlaSecurityNews+%28Joomla!+Security+News%29
  • http://developer.joomla.org/security/news/314-20100501-core-xss-vulnerabilities-in-back-end.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+JoomlaSecurityNews+%28Joomla%21+Security+News%29
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200228225430/https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/40444
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fj57-vhrc-73r7
items.title: [joomla/joomla-cms] Joomla! vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
user/view.php in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 does not properly check a role, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain the full names of other users via the course profile page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1617
  • http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/user/view.php?r1=1.168.2.28&r2=1.168.2.29
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q53j-c866-h9mw
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle doesn't properly check role

items.content_html:
user/view.php in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 does not properly check a role, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain the full names of other users via the course profile page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1617
  • http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/user/view.php?r1=1.168.2.28&r2=1.168.2.29

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle doesn't properly check role

items.content_html:
Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via vectors related to (1) the add_to_log function in mod/wiki/view.php in the wiki module, or (2) "data validation in some forms elements" related to lib/form/selectgroups.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1615
  • http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/lib/form/selectgroups.php?r1=1.2.4.2&r2=1.2.4.3
  • http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/mod/wiki/view.php?r1=1.76.2.6&r2=1.76.2.7
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9xp2-5fr9-7mwm
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to SQL injection

items.content_html:
Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via vectors related to (1) the add_to_log function in mod/wiki/view.php in the wiki module, or (2) "data validation in some forms elements" related to lib/form/selectgroups.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1615
  • http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/lib/form/selectgroups.php?r1=1.2.4.2&r2=1.2.4.3
  • http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/mod/wiki/view.php?r1=1.76.2.6&r2=1.76.2.7
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9xp2-5fr9-7mwm
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to SQL injection

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Piwik before 1.11 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-1844
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/03/12/4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20130313093839/http://piwik.org/blog/2013/03/piwik-1-11
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5fpj-6vq6-fmwh
items.title: [piwik/piwik] Piwik (now Matomo) Vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Piwik before 1.11 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-1844
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/03/12/4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20130313093839/http://piwik.org/blog/2013/03/piwik-1-11
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5fpj-6vq6-fmwh
items.title: [matomo/matomo] Piwik (now Matomo) Vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)

items.content_html:
Piwik before 1.11 accepts input from a POST request instead of a GET request in unspecified circumstances, which might allow attackers to obtain sensitive information by leveraging the logging of parameters.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-2633
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20130313093839/http://piwik.org/blog/2013/03/piwik-1-11
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v8h8-93mx-82h5
items.title: [piwik/piwik] Piwik (now Matomo) Reveals Sensitive Information by Accepting Input from `POST` Requests

items.content_html:
Piwik before 1.11 accepts input from a POST request instead of a GET request in unspecified circumstances, which might allow attackers to obtain sensitive information by leveraging the logging of parameters.

items.title: [matomo/matomo] Piwik (now Matomo) Reveals Sensitive Information by Accepting Input from `POST` Requests

items.content_html:
Unspecified vulnerability in Piwik 1.2 through 1.4 allows remote attackers with the view permission to execute arbitrary code via unknown attack vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4941
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/03/18/1
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/03/19/8
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20110626223028/http://piwik.org/blog/2011/06/piwik-1-5-security-advisory
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2qr8-h6pq-m27v
items.title: [matomo/matomo] Piwik (now Matomo) Vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution

items.content_html:
Unspecified vulnerability in Piwik 1.2 through 1.4 allows remote attackers with the view permission to execute arbitrary code via unknown attack vectors.

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in concrete5 Japanese 5.5.1 through 5.5.2.1 and concrete5 English 5.5.0 through 5.6.0.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2012-5181
  • http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN65458431/index.html
  • http://jvndb.jvn.jp/jvndb/JVNDB-2012-000113
  • http://concrete5-japan.org/news/concrete5602ja-release
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x4x9-4c65-73w8
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete5 Vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 3.3.x before 3.3.10.1 and 3.4.x before 3.4.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted table name that triggers improper HTML rendering on a Tracking page, related to (1) libraries/tbl_links.inc.php and (2) tbl_tracking.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-1940
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin;a=commitdiff;h=7e10c132a3887c8ebfd7a8eee356b28375f1e287
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin;a=commitdiff;h=d3ccf798fdbd4f8a89d4088130637d8dee918492
  • http://www.debian.org/security/2012/dsa-2391
  • http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2011-3.php
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin%3Ba=commitdiff%3Bh=7e10c132a3887c8ebfd7a8eee356b28375f1e287
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin%3Ba=commitdiff%3Bh=d3ccf798fdbd4f8a89d4088130637d8dee918492
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4q58-5x28-53wv
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin Vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 3.3.x before 3.3.10.1 and 3.4.x before 3.4.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted table name that triggers improper HTML rendering on a Tracking page, related to (1) libraries/tbl_links.inc.php and (2) tbl_tracking.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-1940
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin;a=commitdiff;h=7e10c132a3887c8ebfd7a8eee356b28375f1e287
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin;a=commitdiff;h=d3ccf798fdbd4f8a89d4088130637d8dee918492
  • http://www.debian.org/security/2012/dsa-2391
  • http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2011-3.php
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin%3Ba=commitdiff%3Bh=7e10c132a3887c8ebfd7a8eee356b28375f1e287
  • http://phpmyadmin.git.sourceforge.net/git/gitweb.cgi?p=phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin%3Ba=commitdiff%3Bh=d3ccf798fdbd4f8a89d4088130637d8dee918492
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4q58-5x28-53wv
items.title: [phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin] phpMyAdmin Vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the fix_non_standard_entities function in the KSES HTML text cleaning library (weblib.php), as used in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted HTML entities.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1619
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1107
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hhxf-w8hj-43w6
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the fix_non_standard_entities function in the KSES HTML text cleaning library (weblib.php), as used in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via crafted HTML entities.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1619
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://www.vupen.com/english/advisories/2010/1107
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hhxf-w8hj-43w6
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors related to (1) the Login-As feature or (2) when the global search feature is enabled, unspecified global search forms in the Global Search Engine. NOTE: vector 1 might be resultant from a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1614
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5fgv-cvr8-xg48
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Moodle 1.8.x before 1.8.12 and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors related to (1) the Login-As feature or (2) when the global search feature is enabled, unspecified global search forms in the Global Search Engine. NOTE: vector 1 might be resultant from a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1614
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5fgv-cvr8-xg48
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Moodle 1.8.x and 1.9.x before 1.9.8 does not enable the "Regenerate session id during login" setting by default, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct session fixation attacks.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2010-1613
  • http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2010-05/msg00001.html
  • http://moodle.org/security
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j5rc-cr5w-vfg6
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Session Fixation vulnerability
